string.value: When you ask #p1002100# about the book, she says that she gave it to #b#p1002001##k who said he needed it. Ask #p1002001# about the #t4161050#.
#p1002001# says that he borrowed the book because he thought that #p1012101# might be bored and that he gave it to #p1012101# already. Go to #b#m100000000##k and meet #b#p1012101##k.

Are you here to ask me about my wonderful and impressive concoction? No? A book? Oh, #t4161050#? I thought, with that book, I'd be able to concoct something that would give me a Dragon's power, but I was wrong.
I wasn't going to read it anyway, so I gave it to #p1002001# since he wanted it. He even told me he'd return the book himself, so if anything, #p1002001# would have it. Ask #b#p1002001##k.
Oh, you have a strange lizard as a pet. Could I pet it? Oh my, it looks scary. I think I'll just stand back and observe.
Why are you asking me so many questions when you're not even that curious?

Ah, my face itches. Hm? I haven't seen you here before. What can I do for you? I wasn't planning on going out to the sea for a while... Hm? A book? Are you talking about #t4161050# by any chance? If you are, I don't have it.

A man of the sea like me has nothing to do with Dragons. I didn't borrow it for me. I borrowed it for #p1012101# since she's too weak to go anywhere. I already sent it to #b#m100000000##k, so if you want it, talk to #b#p1012101##k.
Anyway, what is that weird pet you've got there? Not too long ago, I saw an adventurer with a Jr. Balrog! People are starting to travel with some strange creatures...
I've already given that book to #b#p1002001##k! Ask #p1002001#. He's right there.
